message.entry: ''{0}'': Base must be numeric.
''{0}'': Base array must be a character vector.
''{0}'': Base value must be within the range of [2, 36].
Value to convert must be character array.
QUANTIZER constructor signature not recognized.
Number of input and output arguments must match with multiple inputs.
Invalid call to dummy QuantizerUDClass constructor. Please report this problem \nto support@mathworks.com, including sample code that reproduces the error.
''{0}'' is derived from other properties and cannot be set explicitly.
RoundMode must be one of ''zero'', ''nearest'', ''ceiling'', ''floor'', ''round'' or ''convergent''.
Exponentlength must be less than wordlength.
Exponent length cannot be greater than 31.
Exponent length cannot be negative.
Function {0} is undefined for quantizer of mode {1}. Output is equal to input.
Invalid parameter/value pair arguments.
Invalid value for property 'Format'. The value must be a two-element vector.
Value to convert must be a double array.
Value to quantize cannot be a fi.
Value to quantize must be numeric.
Only inputs of type double, single, [u]int[8,16,32] are allowed.
{0} is a read-only property.
Num2sdec not defined for float, double or single.
Values of class {0} are not allowed in QUANTIZER objects. Values must be either a vector of length 2, or a character vector.
{0} is not defined for this quantizer mode.
Unspecified scaling is not allowed in quantizer.
Sparse inputs are not supported for methods of class quantizer.
Wordlength must be larger than exponentlength.
Wordlength cannot be greater than 65535.
Wordlength cannot be negative or zero.
